frameDefinitions: This frame concerns transparent nouns that denote Instances of Types of entities or events.
A Mother and Father produce a Child or an Egg. 'Betty bore Gerry three intelligent daughters.'

A  Mitigating_situation is presented as occurring against the backdrop of a more preferable situation and a less preferable situation that, while expected, feared, or hoped for, did not or will not occur; the Mitigating_situation is thus, so to speak, sandwiched between a better and a worse situation, both of which are relevant in the discourse.
Words in this frame have to do with a Cognizer believing that some Phenomenon will take place in the future.

A Suspect in a Current_jurisdiction is forced by Authorities (of the Current_jurisdiction) to go to the Crime_jurisdiction, i.e. the jurisdiction which requested that the Suspect be handed over for trial for a crime which he or she is suspected to have committed in the Crime_jurisdiction.
This frame contains perception words whose perceivers intentionally direct their attention to some entity or phenomenon in order to have a perceptual experience.
frameExamples: The survey confirmed that management interference in team operations had increased , and <t><fex name='Instance'>instances</fex></t> of management decisions being taken without team consultation had also increased .
<t>At least</t> I don’t have to go to school.
The fraud was <t>extradited</t> from Venezuela to the US.
listRoleDefinitions: A thing or episode of a certain <fen>Type</fen>.
The category of thing or event of which an <fen>Instance</fen> is picked out.
<fen>Mother</fen> is the female creature that produces the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Child</fen> identifies the new self-motile creature produced from the <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen>.
<fen>Father</fen> is the male creature that copulates with the <fen>Mother</fen>, thus  leading to the birth of the <fen>Child</fen>.
<fen>Egg</fen> is an immobile object containing an organism that may hatch as a mobile, infant organism.
The <fen>Mother</fen> and <fen>Father</fen> expressed together.
This role identifies the <fen>Time</fen> when the event occurs.
This role identifies the <fen>Place</fen> where the event occurs.

The <fen>Mitigating_situation</fen> is the situation that actually occurs. It is presented in a discourse to mitigate the fact that a better situation did not occur - since the role is still preferable to an even worse situation.

This is the person who believes some Phenomenon will take place in the future. It is normally expressed as an External Argument: <fex name='Cognizer'>Pat</fex> <t>expects</t> that the Yankees will win the World Series.

This is what the Cognizer believes will happen in the future. It can be expressed as a Finite Clause Complement, an NP Object, or a VP Complement with or without an NP Object (see General Grammatical Observations):
An entity that serves as the focus of a predicted <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The time when the <fen>Cognizer</fen> makes the prediction.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> foresees the <fen>Phenomenon</fen>.
The <fen>Authorities</fen> act on behalf of the <fen>Current_jurisdiction</fen>, giving up the <fen>Suspect</fen> to the Crime_jurisdiction.
The jurisdiction (generally a nation) the <fen>Suspect</fen> starts off in.
The jurisdiction (generally a nation) to which the <fen>Suspect</fen> is sent.
The Suspect is forced to go to the jurisdiction where a crime he or she is suspected of took place or is being tried.
The time at which  the <fen>Suspect</fen> is moved.
The location where the extradition occurs.
The <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> performs some action in order to have a perceptual experience. It is expressed as an External Argument:

<fen>Phenomenon</fen> indicates the entity or phenomenon to which the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> directs his or her attention in order to have a perceptual experience. Typically, it is expressed as an Object with verbs.
<fen>Body_part</fen> identifies the part of the body used as a sensory organ of the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen>, typically expressed in a <ment>with</ment>-PP.

<fen>Direction</fen> is used for all path-like expressions that describe how the perceiver's attention is directed during the act of perception, with the exception of those indicating the location of the <fen>Perceiver_agentive</fen> (which would be marked <fen>Location_of_perceiver</fen>)
When the activity of attempting to perceive occurs.
The general location within which the act of perception takes place.
listRoleExamples: I collected two <t>specimens</t> <fex>of this rare species</fex>.
<fex>Betty</fex> bore Gerry three intelligent daughters.
Betty bore Gerry <fex>three intelligent daughters</fex>.
Betty bore <fex>Gerry</fex> three intelligent daughters.
Female clownfish lay <fex>their eggs</fex> around sea anemones
<fex>We</fex> are going to be having twins!
We didn't win $7 million, but at least <fex>I only lost $2 on lottery tickets</fex>.
Pat expects <fex>that the Yankees will win the World Series</fex>.
Predictions <fex>about stock prices</fex> are notoriously undependable.
She predicted the outcry <fex>several months ago</fex>.
<fex>Even at the far side of the house</fex> I could predict what was going on the kitchen.
<fex>French officials</fex> extradited him back to Canada.
Jones was extradited <fex>from Mexico</fex> last Thursday to face criminal charges in the United States.
It was the third time a neo-Nazi was extradited from Denmark <fex>to Germany</fex>.
A hearing on whether or not to extradite <fex>Johnson</fex> to Isreal will be held tomorrow.
<fex>In Europe</fex> they extradite more freely than in North America.
<fex>The waiter</fex> smelled the milk to see if it was fresh.
The waiter smelled <fex>the milk</fex> to see if it was fresh.
You should feel the water <fex>with your toes</fex> before jumping in.
The detective looked <fex>across the street</fex> at the suspect.
